words.definition: To adhere means to act in the way that a rule or agreement says is right.
words.example: If the new employees wish to succeed, they must adhere to the boss’s rules.

words.definition: To administer means to take responsibility for organizing something.
words.example: The teacher’s assistant will administer the test.

words.definition: When people are compassionate, they feel pity and sympathy for others.
words.example: The compassionate nurse tried to make the sick man feel comfortable.

words.definition: To contaminate something means to put dirty or harmful chemicals into it.
words.example: The lake was contaminated when pollutants entered into the water.

words.definition: A deficiency is a lack of something that is needed or required.
words.example: A vitamin deficiency can lead to serious health problems.

words.definition: An epidemic is a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time.
words.example: The flu epidemic spread quickly through the city.

words.definition: A hazard is something that is dangerous and likely to cause damage.
words.example: Smoking is a major health hazard.

words.definition: If something is imperative, it is extremely important and must be done.
words.example: It is imperative that you finish the project on time.

words.definition: Intestines are the tubes in your body through which food passes.
words.example: The food is digested in the stomach and intestines.

words.definition: To manifest means to make something clear or show it by your behavior.
words.example: The symptoms of the disease manifested after a few days.

words.definition: Metabolic relates to the chemical processes in a living thing that change food into energy.
words.example: Exercise can help increase your metabolic rate.

words.definition: When a place is overcrowded, it is full of too many people.
words.example: The bus was so overcrowded that I had to stand.

words.definition: If something is paramount, it is more important than anything else.
words.example: The safety of the passengers is paramount.

words.definition: A practitioner is someone who works as a doctor or lawyer.
words.example: She is a medical practitioner with many years of experience.

words.definition: A provision is the act of providing something or the thing provided.
words.example: The government made provision for the victims of the flood.

words.definition: To replenish something means to fill it up again.
words.example: We need to replenish our water supply before we continue.

words.definition: When something is sterile, it is completely clean and free from bacteria.
words.example: The surgery was performed in a sterile environment.

words.definition: To upgrade something means to improve its quality or importance.
words.example: I decided to upgrade my computer to a faster model.

words.definition: If something is viable, it is capable of working successfully.
words.example: The company’s plan was not considered viable by the investors.

words.definition: If something is voluntary, it is done because you want to do it, not because you have to.
words.example: The students did voluntary work at the hospital.
